lead_paragraph: After making the playoffs the past two years and proclaiming themselves Stanley Cup contenders this season, the Rangers have had a rush on ticket sales. The team said all single-game tickets for the 2007-8 season at Madison Square Garden sold out less than an hour after they went on sale Saturday. Team officials said they believed it was the fastest sellout in franchise history. The Rangers may release some tickets, usually single ones, on game days to be purchased at the box office. All 41 home games sold out last season. The season opens October 4 with a home game against Florida. The first home exhibition game is Friday against the Devils.
